columns.text: This exercise will determine how much money we will have if we deposit $4,500 at the end of the year for the next 20 years and consider a 9.7% interest rate. In addition, we will also determine the value if we deposit it for 40 years instead.

Given the following information:

| | | 
|--|--| 
|Annual deposit |$4,500 | 
|Rate |9.7% | 
|N$_1$ |20 years | 
|N$_2$ |40 years |

To determine the value of our deposits, we will calculate the future value using the FV function on a spreadsheet. The rate we will consider is the interest rate of 9.7%, the pmt amount will be the $4,500 periodic deposits, and the Nper, which refers to the period, will be the 20 years and then 40 years in a separate calculation.

To determine the value of the deposits in 20 and 40 years, we will calculate the future value of the deposits. The future value can be calculated using the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value of an Annuity} &=C\times\dfrac{\left(1+r\right)^t-1}{r}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$C$, which represent the cash amount
$r$, which refers to the rate
$t$, which symbolizes the period

We will consider in our calculation the periodic deposits of $4,500 as the cash amount in our formula. The rate is the interest rate of 9.7%, and the period will be 20 years and then 40 years in a separate calculation.

To conclude, the future value of our deposits are as follows:

| Years | Future value   |
|--------|----------------|
| 20     | $249,119.03    |
| 40     | $1,835,982.10  |
